sub_title: Delivery lead Transformation & OCM @ Plat4mation | ACMP Global Board Member | MBA & MSc. HRM | Transformation & Organisational Change Management
summary:
Isolde Kanikani is the Transformation & OCM Delivery Lead at Plat4mation, a leading service provider of ServiceNow solutions and the inherent large scale transformations that come with this Platform of Platforms. With over 15 years of experience in change management, organizational development, and digital strategy, she helps clients realize their transformation goals and build change capability across their organizations. She holds an MBA and a Master of Science in Human Resources Management, as well as a number of certifications in Prosci, APMG Change Management, ITIL, Lean, Six Sigma, CSM, AgilePM, ServiceNow, and Microsoft. Isolde is a frequent speaker at different events and conferences, along with having published a number of times on topics like Diagnosing organisations, ChangOp's and Building Organisational Change Maturity.

As a Transformation & OCM Delivery Lead, Isolde is responsible for setting up and leading the Transformation, Organisational Change Management, and Adoption Capability at Plat4mation, as well as delivering high-quality consulting services to customers. She is also a global board member and chair of the Global Growth Committee at the Association of Change Management Professionals (ACMP), where she contributes to the advancement of the change management profession and the ACMP community. Additionally, she is the founder of FUTURE:CM, a network that fosters change management innovation and learning. Is regularly speaking on topics of Transformation, Change and governance. As a researcher and innovator she has written a number of publications, whitepapers and book chapters that show case her work and share it with the world. She is passionate about sharing her knowledge and insights through speaking engagements, publications, and webinars on various topics related to change management and digital transformation.

In secondary school, I was in 4 teams and training pretty much every night just after school and then in the evening, some lunchtimes for the school team were included in the mix. 

When I went to college, I joined the college team and totnes netball teams.

projects.title: Project manager: Iwi creatieve ruimte - Buurtcentrum Sterrenzicht
projects.description:
LocationBuurtcentrum sterrenzicht, Utrecht
Iwi is opening a new Creatieve ruimte in Buurtcentrum sterrenzicht (January 2019). With the permission from Gemeente Utrecht we are making a new space and proactively filling it with a great program of classes and workshops for the neighbourhood. At the same time giving new possibilities to organizers who until now found the social centers too expensive to consider as a possible location for their activities. We have the first pilot project running for a year with expansion possibilities after the first months. This is a new way of working for the Gemeente within the Social centers and we are intrigued to see how everything comes together.

Types of tasks include renter management, events organisation, coommunity building, space management and promotion on social media.

contributors.headline: Delivery lead Transformation & OCM @ Plat4mation | ACMP Global Board Member | MBA & MSc. HRM | Transformation & Organisational Change Management

projects.title: I:DNA model for change realisation in SMEs
projects.description:
The I:DNA model was developed as a tool for small organisations, projects and individuals to explore their intrinsic value. Often on whatever level we can waste time, energy and resources because we are not clear about what we need or what our goals are. With a certain amount of clarity created through practical steps, we can not only make a business plan of intrinsic value but also see how we can greater collaboration with other organisations. By establishing our needs and wishes we realize clearly what we need in stakeholders, what they can mean for us and what we can mean for them.

Once the basics of the model are learned, it can be applied to any situation or circumstance. No matter if you are looking at goal setting for your business, making a business plan, dealing with a difficult team situation or looking for personal growth. Its all at your fingertips with this tool. The I:DNA model was designed to be universal leaving the questioners with practical information, tools and a guide to the next steps in goal fulfillment.

projects.title: Crossing Borders (project manager)
projects.description:
Project manager: Crossing Borders: project bringing amateur dancers from different EU countries.
Dates EmployedSep 2009 – Jul 2015
Employment Duration5 yrs 11 mos
LocationEurope
A cross-cultural performance project aimed at getting amateur dancers to perform and deepen their tango technique in the process. With performance evenings and groups in various countries that come together to perform at different events as well as the official Cielito performance showcases. It is a great experience for all involved and brings a sense of community and ties across borders through dance, socializing and the experience of achieving more as a group than we can achieve by ourselves.

profile_positions.title: Founder of FUTURE:CM change management network

profile_positions.description:
- Internal Change manager for EMEA region assisting the Transformation lead for NextGen Sales change project being implemented in SoftwareONE. An HR, Dynamics 365 ERP and CRM system rollout.
- Part of the TAO  innovation team and incubator for adoption & change management, working on new service design that brings change management and the business needs together at SoftwareONE. Designing the Change & governance service horizontal (new matrix organisation structure installment) together with a small team.
- Took part in the ASPIRE leadership development program, one of 25 out of 160 that applied.
- Advising external clients with Microsoft 365 implementations were Aegon, Menzis, IKEA, Amsterdam Local government, New Access, PAYU, Greenchoice, Pink Roccade, Schinkels family brouwers, Wilhelmina Ziekenhuizen (hospital), MIH Fintech, Tata consultancy services, Volkswagen Pon financial services, Tata Motors, Sitetech, Biga Group, Kraft Heinz, Gas NL, Pirelli

Projects:
- Re-designed the cross-departmental processes for all Change and adoption services within SoftwareONE, reducing client onboarding time by 1-2 months.
- Advising on the rollout of OKRs as the system for goal definition in SoftwareONE. 
- Advising on the set-up of an Agile scrum set-up in the ACM service team for service developments.
- Organizing SKUs and supporting process redesign for new change and adoption services in the company
- Designed a Change Playbook for internal use.
- Designing the change and adoption intern program together with the ACM Career & talent development pathways.

Traineeship process consultancy

 The People Side of Change is a primary Prosci partner, and daughter company of De Processpecialisten & Gwynt. There were a number of trainings followed from the Process specialisten:
- Basistraining: PM in de praktijk

profile_positions.title: Change Management Consultant

profile_positions.description:
- Coordinating the growth of CCB Network and the projects we are creating. Worked here from The People Side of Change who was also one of 9 partner organisations of the network.
- Coordinating with a loose team of 16, made up of CCB Network partners and people from their organizations. 
FYI: The People Side of Change is a partner of the European Change competency builders network (CCB Network), my role here is part of my work at The People Side of Change. The network is created by 9 Prosci affiliate organizations, with the aims of growing Prosci change management capability in Europe through sharing-developing change management best practices and international scale change management projects.

CCB stands for Change competency builders network, a collaboration of Prosci affiliated organizations connecting from across Europe. The Network is built and remains the effort of individual partner organizations, collaborating on growing the Change management Best practices in Europe.

Link: https://ccb.network/
